title: Bug 6009: New class wizard doesn't default to the current type in the editor for nested classes
description: When attempting to create a new class using the wizard, the 'Enclosing Type' field does not default to the current type in the editor.
OB: When using Build 20011106, upon clicking the 'New Class' button with a .java file open in the editor, the 'Enclosing Type' field remains blank.
EB: The 'Enclosing Type' field should automatically default to the current type open in the editor when creating a new class.
SR: To reproduce: Using Build 20011106, open a .java file in the editor, click the 'New Class' button, and check the 'Enclosing Type' field, which should default to the current type in the editor.
